Instruction: Prepare a 12-inch cast iron skillet by greasing it.
Combine flour and sugar with baking powder in a large bowl.
Whisk together eggs and milk in a separate bowl.
Combine the beaten eggs with milk in a separate bowl.
Incorporate raisins evenly into the batter.
Pour the batter into the greased cast iron skillet.
Bake the batter in the prepared cast iron skillet until the bread has risen and the top is golden brown, for about 1 hour.
Bake until the bread is risen and golden brown on top, about 1 hour in the preheated oven.
